get.description:
Lists up to 5000 assets, including non-WAS assets.

Requires ADMINISTRATOR [64] user permissions. See Permissions.

200.description: Returns a list of assets.

id.description: The unique ID of the asset.

ipv4.description: A list of ipv4 addresses for the asset.

ipv6.description: A list of ipv6 addresses for the asset.

hostname.description: A list of hostnames for the asset.

fqdn.description: A list of FQDNs for the asset.

ssh_fingerprint.description: The SSH fingerprint for the asset.

mac_address.description: A list of MAC addresses for the asset.

netbios_name.description: The NetBIOS name for the asset.

operating_system.description: The operating system installed on the asset.

system_type.description: The system architecture (x86) of the asset.

operating_system: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Datacenter Service Pack 1
Linux Kernel 4.13.9-300.fc27.x86_64 on Fedora release 27 (Twenty Seven)

post.description:
Imports a list of assets in JSON format. The request cannot exceed 5 MB. Each asset object requires a value for at least one of the following properties: fqdn, ipv4, netbios_name, mac_address.

Requires CAN CONFIGURE [64] scan permissions. See Permissions.

id.description: The unique ID of the asset.

ipv4.description: A list of ipv4 addresses for the asset.

ipv6.description: A list of ipv6 addresses for the asset.

hostname.description: A list of hostnames for the asset.

fqdn.description: A list of FQDNs for the asset.

ssh_fingerprint.description: The SSH fingerprint for the asset.

mac_address.description: A list of MAC addresses for the asset.

netbios_name.description: The NetBIOS name for the asset.

operating_system.description: The operating system installed on the asset.

system_type.description: The system architecture (x86) of the asset.

assets.description: An array of asset objects to import. Each asset object requires a value for at least one of the following properties: fqdn, ipv4, netbios\_name, mac\_address. Each asset object may also optionally contain additional properties for each property of was-assets. If any asset fails to be imported, an error message is returned indicating the cause of the failure.

source.description: An identifier for the script used to upload the assets.

200.description: Returns the import job UUID.

400.description: Returned if the user submitted a bad request.

403.description: Returned if the user does not have permission to import assets.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](/docs/rate-limiting).

response.value:

pluginattributes.synopsis: The remote Ubuntu host is missing a security-related patch.
pluginattributes.description:
Stephane Chazelas discovered the bytecode engine of ClamAV improperly handled recursion under certain circumstances. This could allow a remote attacker to craft a file that could cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

Note that Tenable Network Security has extracted the preceding description block directly from the Ubuntu security advisory. Tenable has attempted to automatically clean and format it as much as possible without introducing additional issues.

429 Too Many Requests

nginx

500.description: Returned if Tenable.io encountered an error while saving the policy.

value.message: An internal server error occurred. Please wait a moment and try your request again.

get.description:
Returns a list of policies, including non-WAS policies.

Requires STANDARD [32] user permissions. See Permissions.

200.description: Returns the policy list.

id.description: The unique ID of the policy.

template_uuid.description: The UUID for the template the policy uses.

name.description: The name of the policy.

owner_id.description: The unique ID of the owner of the policy.

owner.description: The username for the owner of the policy.

shared.description: The shared status of the policy.

user_permissions.description: The sharing permissions for the policy.

creation_date.description: The creation date of the policy in Unix time.

last_modification_date.description: The last modification date for the policy in Unix time.

visibility.description: The visibility of the target (private or shared).

no_target.description: If `true`, the policy does not use targets.

timeout_abort_threshold.description: The number of consecutive timeouts before the scan aborts (minimum 100).

was_browser_cluster_ignore_images.description: Specifies whether images on web pages should be crawled or ignored by the virtual browser instance embedded into the scanner. Possible values are `yes` or `no`.

was_browser_cluster_job_timeout.description: The time that the scanner waits for a response from a browser, unless otherwise specified within a plugin. If you are scanning over a slow connection, you may wish to set this to a higher number of seconds.

was_browser_cluster_screen_height.description: The screen height, in pixels, of the virtual browser instance embedded into the scanner.

was_browser_cluster_screen_width.description: The screen width, in pixels, of the virtual browser instance embedded into the scanner.

was_chrome_script_command_wait.description: When running Selenium scripts for authentication and crawling, the number of milliseconds to wait after processing a command before passing to the next one.

was_chrome_script_finish_wait.description: When running Selenium scripts for authentication and crawling, the number of milliseconds to wait once all commands are processed for rendering new contents.

was_chrome_script_page_load_wait.description: When running Selenium scripts for authentication and crawling, the number of milliseconds to let the browser render the page.

was_http_request_concurrency.description: The maximum number of established HTTP sessions for a single host.

was_http_request_headers.description: A list of custom headers injected into each HTTP request.

was_http_request_redirect_limit.description: The number of redirects the scan follows before it stops trying to crawl the page.

was_http_request_timeout.description: The time that the scanner waits for a response from a host, unless otherwise specified within a plugin. If you are scanning over a slow connection, you may wish to set this to a higher number of seconds.

was_http_response_max_size.description: The maximum load size of a page in order to be audited. If the scanner crawls a URL and the response exceeds the limit, then it is not audited and no vulnerability assessment is performed.

was_http_user_agent.description: The user-agent header used by the scanner when sending an HTTP request. For example, `Nessus WAS/%v` where %v is the version of the scan engine.

was_plugins_autothrottle.description: The plugins autothrottle setting (yes or no).

was_plugins_rate_limiter_requests_per_se.description: The maximum number of HTTP requests for the entire scan for a single host.

was_plugins_selenium_crawl_script.description: The name of the file containing Selenium scripts that Web Application Scanning uploads and uses to crawl during the scan. For more information, see Configure Selenium Authentication in the Tenable.io Web Application Scanning User Guide.

was_scope_directory_depth_limit.description: The maximum number of sub-directories the scanner crawls. For example, http://www.tenable.com/products/tenable-io has two sub-directories.

was_scope_dom_depth_limit.description: The maximum depth of HTML nested elements the scanner crawls.

was_scope_exclude_file_extensions.description: A list of file types excluded from the scan. Possible values are: css, js, png, jpeg, gif, pdf, csv.

get.description:
Check the file status of an exported scan. After you request an export, you must poll this endpoint until a "ready" status is returned, at which point the file is complete and can be downloaded using the was-export-download endpoint.

Requires CAN VIEW [16] scan permissions. See Permissions.

parameters.description: The ID of the scan to export.
parameters.name: scan_id

parameters.description: The ID of the file to poll (Included in response from /was-scans/{scan\_id}/export).
parameters.name: file_uuid

parameters.description: The value `web-app`. This parameter is required only when using the API with Web Application Scanning.
parameters.name: type

200.description: Returns the status of the file. A status of `ready` indicates the file can be downloaded.

404.description: Returned if the file does not exist.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](/docs/rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

nginx

get.description:
Download an exported scan.

Requires CAN VIEW [16] scan permissions. See Permissions.

parameters.description: The ID of the scan to export.
parameters.name: scan_id

parameters.description: The ID of the file to download (Included in response from /scans/{scan\_id}/export).
parameters.name: file_uuid

parameters.description: The value `web-app`. This parameter is required only when using the API with Web Application Scanning.
parameters.name: type

200.description: Returns the content of the file as an attachment.

404.description: Returned if the file does not exist.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](/docs/rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

nginx

get.description:
Returns a scan's history records.

Requires SCAN OPERATOR [24] user permissions and CAN VIEW [16] scan permissions. See Permissions.

parameters.description: The identifier for the scan. This identifier can be the either the `schedule_uuid` or the numeric `id` attribute for the scan. We recommend that you use `schedule_uuid`.
parameters.name: scan_id

parameters.description: Maximum number of objects requested (or service imposed limit if not in request). The max limit value allowed is 50. Must be in the int32 format.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Offset from request (or zero). Must be in the int32 format.
parameters.name: offset

200.description: Returns a scan's history records.

total.description: The total number of objects matching your search criteria. Must be in the int32 format.

limit.description: Maximum number of objects requested (or service imposed limit if not in request). Must be in the int32 format.

offset.description: Offset from request (or zero). Must be in the int32 format.

sort.description: An array of objects representing the fields you specified as sort fields in the request message, which Tenable.io uses to sort the returned data.

name.description: The field on which Tenable.io sorts the results.

order.description: The direction of the sort order. Supported values are `asc` (ascending) and `desc` (descending).

time_end.description: The date the scan completed in Unix time.

time_start.description: The date the scan started in Unix time.

visibility.description: The visibility of the scan in workbenches (public or private).

targets.description: The target parameters used to launch the scan.

custom.description: If `true`, then custom parameters were used to launch the scan.

default.description: If `true`, then default parameters were used to launch the scan..

status.description: The status of the scan (completed, aborted, imported, pending, running, resuming, canceling, canceled, pausing, paused, stopping, stopped).

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io cannot find the specified `scan_id`.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](/docs/rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

nginx

get.description:
Returns the details of a previous result of a scan.

Requires CAN VIEW [16] scan permissions. See Permissions.

parameters.description: The ID of the scan to retrieve.
parameters.name: scan_id

parameters.description: The UUID of the historical scan result to return details about.
parameters.name: history_uuid

200.description: Returns details of the historical scan result.

404.description: Returned if scan_id or history_uuid are not found.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](/docs/rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

nginx

delete.description:
Deletes historical results from a scan.

Requires CAN CONFIGURE [64] scan permissions. See Permissions.

parameters.description: The ID of the scan.
parameters.name: scan_id

parameters.description: The ID of the results to delete.
parameters.name: history_uuid

200.description: Returned if Tenable.io successfully deleted the results.

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io could not find the results.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](/docs/rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

nginx

500.description: Returned if Tenable.io failed to delete the results.

value.message: An internal server error occurred. Please wait a moment and try your request again.

501.description: Returned if Tenable.io does not support deleting historical scan results.

value.message: This feature is not yet implemented.

get.description:
Returns details for the specified host.

Requires CAN VIEW [16] scan permissions. See Permissions.

parameters.description: The UUID of the scan to retrieve. While scan UUID is preferred, scan ID is supported.
parameters.name: scan_uuid

parameters.description: The ID of the host to retrieve.
parameters.name: host_id

parameters.description: The ID of the historical data that should be returned.
parameters.name: history_id

parameters.description: The UUID of the historical data that should be returned.
parameters.name: history_uuid

200.description: Returns the host details.

host_id.description: The unique ID of the host where the scan identified the vulnerability.

hostname.description: The name of the host where the scan identified the vulnerability.

plugin_id.description: The unique ID of the vulnerability plugin.

plugin_name.description: The name of the vulnerability plugin.

plugin_family.description: The parent family of the vulnerability plugin.

vuln_index.description: The index of the vulnerability plugin.

severity_index.description: The severity index order of the plugin.

vulnerabilities.plugin_name: ICMP Timestamp Request Remote Date Disclosure
SSH Server Type and Version Information

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](/docs/rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

nginx

get.description:
Returns the output for a given plugin.

Requires CAN VIEW [16] scan permissions. See Permissions.

parameters.description: The UUID of the scan to retrieve. While scan UUID is preferred, scan ID is supported.
parameters.name: scan_uuid

parameters.description: The ID of the host to retrieve.
parameters.name: host_id

parameters.description: The ID of the plugin to retrieve.
parameters.name: plugin_id

parameters.description: The ID of the historical data that should be returned.
parameters.name: history_id

parameters.description: The UUID of the historical data that should be returned.
parameters.name: history_uuid

200.description: Returns the plugin output.

has_attachment.description: If the value is `1`, the plugin output contains files that may be exported.

custom_description.description: A custom description of the plugin.

plugin_output.description: The text of the plugin output.

hosts.description: Other hosts with the same output.

pluginattributes.solution: Remove any software that is not in compliance with your organization's acceptable use and security policies.
pluginattributes.description: Nessus was able to list the software installed on the remote host by calling the appropriate command (e.g., `rpm -qa` on RPM-based Linux distributions, qpkg, dpkg, etc.).
pluginattributes.synopsis: It was possible to enumerate installed software on the remote host via SSH.

get.description:
Gets the requested scan attachment file.

Requires CAN VIEW [16] scan permissions. See Permissions.

parameters.description: The ID of the scan containing the attachment.
parameters.name: scan_id

parameters.description: The ID of the scan attachment.
parameters.name: attachment_id

parameters.description: The attachment access token.
parameters.name: key

200.description: Returns the attachment file.

404.description: Returned if the attachment file does not exist.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](/docs/rate-limiting).

response.value:
429 Too Many Requests

get.description:
Returns the timezones list for creating a scan.

Requires STANDARD [32] user permissions. See Permissions.

200.description: Returns the timezone list.

name.description: The readable name of the timezone.

value.description: The system value for the timezone.

403.description: Returned if the user does not have permission to view timezones.

429 Too Many Requests
